summary:
## Space Shuttle Challenger Disaster

On January 28, 1986, the Space Shuttle Challenger exploded 73 seconds after takeoff, killing all seven astronauts. The cause was a failed seal in the right rocket booster, caused by cold temperatures. This led to a leak of hot gas, which destroyed the shuttle.

The accident was blamed on NASA's safety practices and decision-making. After the disaster, NASA improved safety measures and built a new shuttle, the Endeavour.
title: Space Shuttle Challenger disaster
